contentrichtext.text: [[Louis Torres]] Vanity. [[User:Maroux|Maroux]] 01:08, 2004 Apr 4 (UTC) * Delete -- [[User:Cyrius|Cyrius]] | [[User talk:Cyrius|Talk]] 01:48, Apr 4, 2004 (UTC) *Comment. Two books currently available from Walmart/Amazon/B&N, from publishers that seem to be non-vanity and scholarly. I'm too new here (about 5 weeks, only 12-1400 edits)--do we have a standard threshold for authors? [[User:Niteowlneils|Niteowlneils]] 06:01, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) ::OK, I've formatted the article and expanded it to include his ''offline'' accomplishments to give people a better view to vote on. [[User:Niteowlneils|Niteowlneils]] 06:01, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete: personal promotion. [[User:66.108.138.83]] has littered other articles ([[art]], [[Ayn Rand]], [[definition of art]]) with promotional stuff, and also created the promotional article [[Michelle Marder Kamhi]]. Away with this garbage; let him/her pay for advertising. [[User:Wile E. Heresiarch|Wile E. Heresiarch]] 14:11, 6 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete. There is no meaningful content in the article, just the two-book bibliography. Bear in mind that the large booksellers (Amazon etc) now have micropublisher programs in place to sell books that only sell a handful of copies, so presence on Amazon no longer connotes mainstream sales. [[User:UninvitedCompany|UninvitedCompany]] 20:28, 6 Apr 2004 (UTC) *This did not have the VfD note on it. I've put it on now. I think it should be kept for at least another five days before a decision is made. The article seems factual and correct, so I see no reason to delete it. [[User:Camembert|Camembert]] 14:50, 12 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Keep. [[User:BL|BL]] 07:41, Apr 19, 2004 (UTC) *Keep. [[User:Anthony DiPierro|anthony]] [[User:Anthony_DiPierro/warning|(see warning)]]
